gZzTfRKO-vO07NfPexFxdQ.text: I will start by confessing that I was a little bit skeptical when I saw that Vapianos was being launched in the UK.  It is a massive chain in Germany (the Germans *love* Italian food from what I can gather, don't we all), but the 'Oyster card for your food' didn't seem like it would take off here at first.However, after several impromptu visits to Vapianos I can advocate that I am a massive fan.  Looks its not brain surgery, it's pizza, pasta and salads.  They have daily specials, they cook the food in front of you, and if there is an ingredient that you do not want to be included in your dish, they will leave it out for you.  The staff reliably inform me that the pizza and pasta are all baked/made fresh each morning, and the staff are all very house proud which is always nice.The seating is a free for all and you can hide away in a dark corner in the back, on a cushy sofa or table by the window or on the mezzanine level upstairs.There's also a separate coffee bar for the post-dining caffeine hit, or you can come here just for coffee. They really don't care, just come and pay a visit, you're always welcome.I've come here at different times of day on different days of the week, and with spring upon us, it always has a nice and relaxed vibe, inside and out (there is some outdoor seating now as well - if you can avoid being caught out by the wind).With free gummy bears available at the till, there are really no downsides to this place. Friends who I have brought here are always pleasantly surprised at this hidden gem (just a stone's throw from the chaos of Oxford Circus) and they have themselves spread on the good word.I mean it, enjoy.x

VBsAeV764aQXBIii9HLAOg.text: When we went, early on a Sunday evening, this place was really busy. As a group of 4 we elected to send 2 to tables and 2 to get food. The food mission took around 20 minutes, not the ideal way to socialise with friends. Great food once it arrived, and reasonably priced for central London, but it was too busy to be a smooth process.

AMEDNhwk7a7sgmgVJMl6qw.text: God my review couldn't really be much further from my fellow Yelpers.I had a really awful experience here last week and have been telling everyone who'll listen. I was persuaded by a German friend who prescribed it was the best thing since sliced bread, well in Germany at least. We went in about 6:30 on a Wednesday evening, it was buzzy and bright.I headed straight for one of the many banks of people waiting for pasta. I chose my pasta after a minute or two and 10 minutes later I was still waiting to have my order taken. Another 5 minutes more went by and I finally got to order my Fig & Spicy Sausage Pasta. Another few minutes a swipe of my card and I had a tray and a big bowl of pasta.By the time I had arrived at the table my companion had about a third of a cold pizza left and a lonely look on her face. I sat down and was glad too see she had been prepared enough to buy drinks for us both, as I certainly wasn't going to venture back out.So to the reason people come here 'apparently'. My Fig & Spicy Sausage Pasta had plenty of fresh fig, which pleased me, but last time I checked there was a difference between Italian Spicy Sausage and peperoni. This is the kind of school boy error that Pizza Hut would make and I wouldn't expect of a place that charges nearly £9 for a bowl of pasta, accompanied by the privilege of queuing 20 minutes. It doesn't help there are a few perfectly fine Italian chains a block away.I decided to order a salad and park my pasta, and stupidly didn't check the prices beforehand. I really shouldn't have been surprised that the mozarella and tomato salad was about £5. A large bottle of water later and a bill for over £18, I wasn't a happy bunny...

rGatNqYo4QiLeu5vtolUvw.text: The food is great and the ambience is too :) the only thing is the wait for the food when it's busy and having to split up with friends while half sit at a table and the others queue for food. But once everyone is settled, the busy atmosphere and great food is worth it :)

6ZX13qbfXa_qIQm-75jhVw.text: I used to really like Vapiano... but now, it's just WAY too crowded. And some of the people that go there are starting to get a bit annoying - they seem to come in a big group, most of them going straight to a table, while only a few of them actually order food. The rest seem to think they're gangster because they "have a table and a bottle at this popular place off Oxford Street on a Friday night". It just gets a bit tiring when I want to eat dinner and be on my way, yet have to wait for ages in line (like in a canteen) and then have to wait for a space at a shared table. The food is decent and the prices pretty good, but I'm starting to think it's really not worth it.

JqZHXYJ6GzabHRN_Alh8qQ.text: Spent 20 mins trying to find a place to sit, and then 40 mins in line waiting to order pasta. So lost an hour just waiting around. The whole system is hugely inefficient.If they let you order pizza and give you a buzzer to collect your order, why not do the same for the pasta? why make ppl wait in line for 1 chef to cook pasta for 8 ppl infront of me, which means i have to waste 40 mins just waiting to be served and then another 10 mins for my pasta to be cooked.Only go if you're going to order pizza, not worth wasting time for half-decent pasta.Sorry Vapiano - I don't like leaving bad reviews, but you leave me no choice.

GUZo6NIN-JTRilziLprXpQ.text: I've recently been introduced to Vapiano's by a good friend, and I can't believe I didn't know this little Italian gem was hidden round the corner from Oxford Circus tube. Walk through the doors to be greeted by friendly staff who hand you something like a food credit card which you use for payment later and go through to find yourself a nice spot either in the lounge area or on the bench style tables. The concept is DIY so don't expect any service after this initial greeting, I think this is why we all like it so much, it's less formal and you are left to your own devices. Each different food station serves different food, so one for pasta, one for pizza, one for salad, and one for wine (that also serves as the dessert point). You queue at each and watch your meal being prepared in front of you. At this point everyone seems to split up and go on their meal mission, but then we all meet back at base when we've collected. The chefs are super nice and strangers often start chatting whilst they wait for their food, which is a novel thing here in London! Then when your food is ready, pop your card on the electronic reader and the cost has been added. Simple. I can't recommend the crayfish and lobster sauce and the beef tenderloin and mushroom pasta enough. They cook the pasta to perfection and everything is super fresh. One note though; the salad doesn't really seem worth the money, unless you get the 'Insalata Mista' which seems to have a bit of everything thrown in. You may be full by this point, but have a break before squeezing in a gorgeous panna cotta. I think they're the best I've had in London and at £3.75 you can't say no.I love the vibrant atmosphere here and it's always the first place the girls decide to meet for our weekly round up. The fact that you all have your own food cash card means that there's no tallying up bills at the end (or even waiting for one) so you just settle up on the way out. Oh and the award for most basil plants in one restaurant must go to Vapiano's too!

Mp-JYdUQMLnqNVTee2RVSg.text: Classy pasta, pizza and a bar  if you're the person who needs to kill too much time, you'll find Vapianos for you. The fact that you'll get a swipe card, queue for your food, tell the chef how you like your food  from various options of pasta, sauce and other spices  and the massive wait til it's all ready is graciously too much. As it was claimed by its management that its the fastest casual restaurant  well then its not.The food are nice. In obvious reason that you're the one who asked how you like it prepared.

3GThD_j-QLHhYfNu5_ztIw.text: Love this place! The food is always amazing. However the only downside would be that its almost always packed and gets hard to find a seat.

AI8nC1UXUVi9uHniTGvW4Q.text: Since brave, pioneering Yelpers went before us and explained the oyster card style system, it was no hassle at all. Despite this unnecessary gimmick, I really liked Vapiano. Mostly because the salad I had was amazing, accompanied by their fabulous ciabatta bread.  I caught a glimpse of the pizzas whizzing by, they looked far too saucy (giggle) and undercooked. I guess when people are standing about waiting, they chuck it in and out in about ten minutes. A decent pizza takes about 15 mins to cook (info garnered from a summer as a pizza slinging waitress who sometimes forgot orders).  I think the card thing is totally unnecessary, you should just order and pay at the till like Nandos. But I guess it gets the punters in and that's what they want. A solid three stars, I'd definitely go back.

C2h91-NBv-LTdiSe_4Fp8w.text: Wow.  Upstairs is a Basil plant station that looks exactly what I always imagined what a home grown weed factory looks like.  Without the weed obviously.Anyways, unlike Fazan, we didn't fail completely at Vapiano and the caesar salad and bruschettas were pretty good.  I'll go on a brag thing now and say the caesar salad dressing is not as good as the wolfgang puck recipe I got from epicurious, but boy were their fatty fried croutons delicious.Getting stuffed for this quality of food in this area of town for less than £10?  Amazing.The basil plant on every table so you can help yourself thing is pretty genius too.  And they sure put enough cheap parmesan on my salad to feed urm... a cow, so no need to ask for that.

LfJ5uVc59tg3n36MWqaDzw.text: This is a really nice, large, modern Italian venue with rustic tables and chairs. My brother kept raving about how great this place was and how decent the prices were so I tried it out. During my one week stay in London, I went here twice for dinner. Great place to meet up with friends and have lunch or dinner at a reasonable price. I did not give it five stars because finding seats is sometimes a bit of a hassle.

lU1MADhLJAhYeSuiAZYqBw.text: Vapiano's is directly behind Topshop Ox Circus and used to be a good place to fill my boots when on a late shift...they do take away, as well as eat in, in swanky plastic boxes, that you can recycle as lunch boxes. This always makes my homemade salads look posher when brought to work. Result. Food. Now, menu is slightly limited but you can add/mix toppings anyways as it's all cooked up fresh. Upon entering, you get given a 'credit card' and everything you purchase (food and drink) you swipe the card and then pay for it all upon exit. Sweeet. Think its quite easy not to I've heard as well. A-hem....Pasta, pizza's and salads come listed on menu in price ranges so there's something for all tastes and budgets which I love. Pasta line is always looooong tho which is a bit of a snore to be honest but food is lovely and so worth wait I guess. They make it all in front of you so you add whatever you like. Same with salads. For pizza's they give you a buzzer once you've ordered and you have to return to collect it once buzzed. Painful when upstairs though, sucks ass. Ambiance. Quite a loud, hectic sorta place really. Great for groups, not for couples or a quiet evening bite I would say. Location wise is great for an after work/shopping bite though. Never had a dessert here as always full to brim on carbs and beer. Classy. I do however always take a handful of sweetie (at till) for journey home.

WJcG8vSbYW4_bMZI4MOkXw.text: I work in central London near Oxford Circus.  Vapiano is my favorite lunch spot.  Start with great food - made right in front of you, pasta fresh made each day - simple, quality - flavorful.  Don't expect to be waited on, nor should you let that deter you - the service is efficient, the atmosphere is casual and the price is fantastic.  Payment system makes it easy to go with a group of friends.

sNYq_-BXoPpVxXLDSrGERA.text: I went here with a fellow blogger last night and have to say I really enjoyed the atmosphere. We both went for pizza, which admittedly took an age to arrive, but we were quite happy with a glass of wine while we waited. The concept of swiping a card each time you order a drink, meal or dessert seems to work well and although it means you don't get service, it also means you don't have to pay for it. A glass of wine and a pizza came in at £10 which I thought was a bit of a bargain. It's probably really in the same league with places like Nandos, but the grub is tasty and the atmosphere is fun.

zJjkjEnpY3hkTJV8MxE0xA.text: This is quite a dining experience, firstly most of the food you watch being cooked in front of you and secondly, there are no waiters.As you walk though the doors you are greeted by very friendly staff who give you a little card (a bit like your Oyster) and explain how the system works. You look at the simple menus, choose what you would like, get up, go to the kitchen and tell the chefs what you want. They will cook it for you right in front of your eyes. The same goes for drinks, you have to go up to the bar and present your card to get one.The food is reasonably priced and with the card system it's pretty good to go with a group of friends as splitting the bill at the end is not a problem with all the cards.The food is tasty but nothing really to write home about. One thing that sets it apart from other Italian places in the area, or at least in my opinion, is the fact that the chiefs tell you what goes best together when creating your own dish. As it's service is a bit of a talking point this is a great first date place as well as it being relaxed and friendly with a funky crowd of people.The food is reasonably priced but the drinks do make the bill creep up. Highly recommended.

4tfoKoF3iMqINg1mxhpfgw.text: RFID used at a restaurant. This blew my silicon valley heart away and then it all felt a little like love. I was visiting some coworkers on Regent Street when they suggested going here. Normally the lunches we bring them to in the US consist of Chipotles, the work caffe, and In N Out. So when they suggested Chinese, German Italian food or some other cuisine, I definitely thought ok. It's been two weeks since I had pizza I will give that a whirl. We get there and at the front desk you need to pick up an RFID card. What? OMG RFID! Then they have various stands where you can get pasta made right for you, pizza, antipasti and calzones all at lunch time costs, as well as beer and other assorted drinks. Once you order you slide your RFID card up to the reader and they program in what you ordered. If you ordered a pizza you get a buzzer for when it's ready and if you ordered pasta they make it there for you on the spot. Ingredients are fresh, so fresh in fact that they have a mini greenhouse area filled with potted basil. Once you get your food you grab a pot and put it in the center of the table in the area designated for the pots. Can we say well thought out? The decorum is clean and bright upstairs and more medium mood lighting downstairs. Almost everyone in our group got the pizza and it was relatively inexpensive. I ordered the crudo pizza which was a tomato based item with mozzarella, prosciutto, and parmesan.  It was a large portion and delicious. My travel companion ordered pomodoro fresco e basilico with whole wheat pasta. It was delicious as well. Russell S. ordered a calzone which came out looking delicious. Did I mention they had RFID cards to take your order and pay by? Awesome. By the end you just hand the cashier your card on the way out and you're done.

5H_R2Sqw4LHeovGcUmUnpw.text: Bon rapport qualite prix. Le restaurant est bien situe et les prix abordables. L assiette de pates est tres bonne et copieuse. Les pizzas ont une pate fine a l italienne, tres bonne. Bon endroit pour manger au lunch entre amis ou famille.

yXt6VQrupU-neCWDaYERvA.text: OK, the pizza, pasta and wine are good quality and not over priced  Italian style with an international flavour  and the interior decor offers a good range of eating styles and table sizes. Don't forget there's a less hectic upstairs room. But none of that is as important as this place's USP: Personalised billing. You get given a swipe card and buzzer when you go in and load up your orders on the card, collect them when you get buzzed and pay at the end. Go inside yourself, meet a friend or group there, don't feel guilty about who should have paid, or waste any of your free fun time sorting out the bill!

bDUwQZ72TKByR40f7FmJYg.text: When I need a lunch break I come here with co workers and we love Vapiano. Pasta is fantastic and the pizza was delicious. One of my favorite places to eat. The atmosphere is great with comfy places to sit in groups. Does get busy but I don't really mind because I like the food.

KEu-kZaY6WW75R-7XnrLXw.text: Serve yourself pizzeria just off Oxford Circus... Not as hellish as it sounds!The pizza isn't memorable, though it is fresh and prepared in front of you. I don't have a problem with DIY service, and Vapiano certainly fills a hole for decent reasonably priced Italian in this area, but it's not going to blow your mind...

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

JrmsAI6FviNtt-FkE7sI9g.text: The venue is large, clean and modern.On entry you are greeted and given a card (yes, the oyster card system everyone has mentioned already). If you haven't been there before they will explain how it works but it's very simple. Personally I like it. I don't know what all the fuss is about with the card system (that's why I like it in fact, there is no fuss).You can choose from salads and antipasti, pasta or pizza. For me it's pasta every time so haven't tried the pizza and it takes longer.You walk up to the counter, tell the chef which dish you would like and which type of pasta to go with it. They make it in front of you and you can specify if you want or don't want garlic, chili, cheese etc. - just add it all in for me.They have several specials each time. All pasta is fresh and made in the restaurant. Today I had the 'pasta cognac' with chicken, bacon, cream, peas, tomato sauce, a splash of cognac with linguine which I highly recommend if you see it next time.A good and satisfying portion size too. It's an efficient operation and tables are kept clean. It does get busy at peak times and I see people with their low reviews complaining about long queues. I don't deal with queues well either so for that reason I tend not to visit places when I know they will be super busy and go just before or after the busiest period. Maybe that's why I've never had to wait more than about 5 minutes which is pretty good in my book.Prices are reasonable for the location just off Oxford Circus where everywhere always seems crowded, all the time.So overall 4 stars for good food, clean efficient ambience, consistency in standard and reasonable value. I am definitely a fan.

yc5rLsbVB1nBa_NXYi-K4g.text: Whenever I head to this place I'm always happy.One, because I know that no matter how many times I come, the seats in front of the in-house pasta maker are almost always empty so I get to watch pasta being made and the meals being cooked (yup, quite sad). Two, I know that I'm going to get pretty chunky sized portions of fresh, just cooked pasta/pizza/salads (not so many salads eaten admittedly). Three, it's really cheap for what it is, with great wines and staff that are a pleasure. The tacchino piccante is a really solid, spicy chicken pasta dish, the pizzas are fantastic (and the little gadget they give you to let you know when it has finished cooking actually causes you to be fixated on what is basically a buzzer for 5 minutes) and the desserts...oh the desserts. (Finally, and not really related, it's just around the corner from a really good Sam Smiths pub, The Cock Tavern).I've only eaten downstairs here (either at the big pot-tree or at the afore-mentioned anorak seat) but have been upstairs on occasion, where you'll see all of the herbs that they use on-site being grown inbetween the tables in miniature greenhouses. As things are a bit more open upstairs I'm not really that tempted to change my routine but most of my friends really enjoy the slightly different ambience.Main positives for me though are the cost versus the quality of food. I don't mind queueing for 2 or 3 minutes when you get the spectacle of seeing your food cooked in front of you, and I quite enjoy the idea of getting up and getting my own drinks (because it means you don't have to wait 5-10 minutes for your waiter to get back to you as per a standard restaurant). Great place.Slight side note- really solid second-date location as the place really is different so has more than a few talking points, and the fact that you have to get up to get your own food means you can either a) take a breather or b) look like the perfect gentleman by getting your partners food. Winner.Only minor issue you might have - if you're in a really sizeable group (8+) then you may have slightly different waiting times, akin to what can happen sometimes at Wagamamas. The atmosphere, novelty and food more than make up for this though.

75ovd1FII4SN6wIPoL5Xeg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in London. I have a great experience every time I go. The staff are friendly and the food quality is fantastic. No matter what I have, pizza, amazing pastas, and the salads are all terrific. The atmosphere is casual and elegant all at the same time. The only thing I could critique is its a little tough going as a group to have you meals prepared at the same time. I still love it though.

BtI4qUXmDs6e8YtkIXlx9A.text: Vapiano is situated in the heart of Oxford Street, so it can get pretty chaotic and finding a table can be quiet difficult. So, if you are looking for a quiet meal - you're out of luck my friend. Their only saving grace is the food - pasta, pizza or salad - made to perfection right before your very eyes.

5fH178YsqC82bSDhqUlW1w.text: Fabulous! This is seriously good food. Fresh, affordable and tasty. My lunch break has been transformed. Staff are informed and willing to help with any pasta/pizza picking panics. All toppings on both pizzas and pastas were tasty and well balanced. Seriously singing the praises of this place. Great for a pre theatre dinner or long lunch. Im sure it caters for it all. YUM!

5iAsPt_mkH3vjpL6BdNcoQ.text: Great dining experience for a first time traveler to London. The service, decor, and food were thoroughly enjoyable. I will definitely be back again.

isUYdYWGc2wvoboaf2IJ9Q.text: Eh...not for the feint hearted. Admittedly, I'm easily overwhelmed, but when you have to enter into full-on, survival-of-the-fittest mode just to get a dinner tray and a menu, let alone a seat, it's a bit extreme for a dining situation. My memory of the place is a bit of a flurry, but I recall being somehow carried through the doors by the crowd rushing in behind me and instantly wanting to leave. Having a little plastic card shoved into my hand, I only vaguely knew what to do because a friend of mine had been there previously and explained the concept to me. Although many Yelpers complain about the card system, I think it's necessary to preserve any form of efficiency in a place as chaotic as Vapiano. (Imagine having to split the bill there. I shudder to think...) Apart from that, the concept seemed a contradiction in terms. You have to be polite and patient enough to stand around in a queue for half an hour, yet ruthless enough to fight to the death for you and your party to get a table together. And that's just before the starters arrive.One thing I would suggest to survive the experience is, (especially if you're with someone and you don't like being left on your own for too long) to try and order something similar. My friend stood in the queue for pasta whilst I sat holding a buzzer, waiting for my (albeit delicious) pizza. I would have stayed for dessert, but an evening at Vapiano presented itself to me as an eating, rather than dining experience. By all means, go there for the food. Go there for the friendly staff. Go there for the free gummy bears at the end. But if you want to eat your dinner with a friend and have great conversations you can actually hear without being elbowed in the ribs, I would suggest ordering to go.

8qPm3zC-U_99vszRS8k2yA.text: This is by far one of my fav restaurants to go to in London. Bare in mind if does get rather busy at dinner times because there are a lot of offices around the restaurant.A very unique style of ordering you there are chefs counters around the restaurant and you tell them exactly what you what and watch your food being cooked. A really good experience though and you have full control of what goes into your food.Quality of the food is really good and price is very reasonable, I will definately keep coming back here!

fIKYibyP8mVBGAQss8RxkA.text: I feel that the food being prepared infront of you is more of a gimmick than anything, we were asked how we liked our meat but then the chef left it to burn while he went to get some more rubber gloves. He also added chilli to my dish by accident but shrugged it off. The pasta is nice but undercooked which is surprising seeing as it took us about 45 minutes to get two bowls of pasta, thanks but no thanks

MP-5A7OZObVP8Pmb5D3dqQ.text: This place became one of our favorite places to eat while we stayed in London. Food was great! We had pastas, pizza, calzone.. Very good and fair price. If you come in the middle of lunch que for pasta is nuts!

xv_TEcLJcHAUwtLnFXIRWQ.text: Vapiano was a bit chaotic. I know it's near Christmas and all that, but queueing and the self service is all a bit strange when you first arrive and your best friend who has been there, doesn't explain to you the concept. The staff are just meh. Not rude, not polite, just there for want of a better way to describe it. The food was alright. I had the bruschetta, which was tasty but then they didn't use proper red tomatoes... you know.. the ones with flavour.. so I had to a chuck a load of balsamic vinegar on it to make it taste of something. The pasta was OK. I had the fresh basil and tomato and my friend had the salami one which looked infinitely better than mine. So there I was, major food envy and a whole load of balsamic vinegar, pining after hers. I would come back here, possibly at lunch when it might be a bit quieter and you don't have to queue. It's an interesting idea and good for a quick bite to eat when you're the Oxford Circus area.

fDnE2rCCuphQ960m9N-0_Q.text: I just Love it .As a large group you wouldn't have to deal with splitting the check,  cause every individual has its own chip card... The food is amazing aswell, my favourite is SCAMPI E SPINACI Pasta : )

QupSdukuYzzVuReZPp6Kpg.text: Founded in Germany in 2002, Vapiano can now be found all around the world. I first encountered Vapiano in 2008 in Stockholm - and liked it (see qype.co.uk/place/92279-V…) . On a sunny day I passed by a Vapiano restaurant in London and decided to go there soon to see, if it's as good in London as it is in Stockholm and Frankfurt. And it is. I really like the concept, that your food gets made right in front of you - fresh, but of course with prepared ingredients. The interior is quite simplistic, what I also appreciate. If you look for relatively cheap but still very good Italian food in central London, Vapiano is definitely the place to go to!

mk3Gf96yj_cNMb0_XoCAxw.text: This is a neat concept. You come in, you stand in a queue, pasta is cooked fresh, and immediately handed to you. You pick your toppings and your form of pasta. I enjoyed it, quite frankly. The food was quite good, even though I really don't see the point of standing in queue. If anything, it just saves them money on waitstaff. Brilliant. The pizza and the mascarpone with strawberry desert were yummy too. The only problem: one of the queues closed down unexpectedly, while people were still waiting there. They all had to redistribute to other queues. That was quite a dick move.

fe7y4XHiSaQPBp0tT7Hpww.text: I was also sceptical of Vapiano. It wasn't the oyster card service or the lack of waiters. You walk in and everything is just a little too clean... a little too nice. There are fresh pots of basil at every table for you to use with your meal. There are high ceilings and lots of light. If you go up stairs (which is an even nicer area to eat) you feel like you are in a commercial for a dining experience... and you really like it. Its the kind of place where you walk in and would not be surprised if Nicolas Cage sat down at your table with his shirt half unbuttoned, holding a wine glass and told you important information- seconds before an expensive car crashed through the window. That being said, the food was absolutely amazing. I had the daily special- rabbit in mustard sauce on spelt pasta and it was great. I think they might have over salted the water, but I didn't care. The deliciousness more than made up for it. I am a big fan. For this part of town, the prices are a steal. I wish I had known about this place when I was a student. Only problem: If you are starving, waiting in line for food is really annoying but good things come to those who wait.Eat here, young bunnies of London. Eat here!

Nv70LuNN3QL3gF_vEY4_rA.text: Very pleasant concept, it's good, fast and cheap. You can have a pizza, pasta or a salad in a very good atmosphere for less than 10 pounds !!!!I highly recomend it .

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

8FIxjCCEKHRZumVB0EMi6g.text: This place is great for big groups because everyone can pay separetely at the end of the meal. When you come in they give you a card and the card holds your menu selection on it- you just bring it up at the end to pay. The pasta I got here was good. I got the penne rosso- it was very flavorsome and the cooking staff was very friendly! Would come back again. I can see this place getting busy though- and on a busy night I can't see this place being that romantic but good for friend groups!!

xJ6O_Ov4dL1ubYt_JXjM8g.text: Was my first visit to Vapiano today and it was a mixed experience. I wanted to have a pizza but there was an half hour wait so I chose to have pasta which interestingly took more than half n hour, so yeah the place was maddening busy. Though the manager got a plate of pizza for everybody waiting for their food and I was one of the 100's to grab a bite. That was something nice to keep your customers going.Pasta was nice. No complains. Will visit again!

NiyW_Os9NfYmHnJkYX2L1Q.text: Pasta is ok pizza is shyte. Wierd concept with no waiter where you stand in line and order from a counter. They have different counters for different items so noone's food comes out at the same time in a group. Its somewhere between fastfood and a sit down resturant.  With all the brilliant resturants in the area avoid this one

51YngxHLZhfOLPrQraWNrQ.text: I really liked this place! Located in the centre of town, just off oxford street. Offering pizza, pasta and more. Its a bit like fast food but healthy. I had a margarita with lots of chilli which was really nice.You walk in and grab a table. Once you're settled, you walk down to the food area where they make your choice of pizza and pasta in front of you. This is all assigned to a card which you're given as you walk in the door.You pay when you leave!It was huge inside with seating both upstairs and downstairs. Upstairs is the bar where they serve a wide range of beers and soft drinks.Really, nice overall! Definitely one I'll come back to!

VCIkpyX40fQax0hMsYwuHw.text: Delicious. The layout is different in that you order sort of canteen-style first but the whole ambiance is very classy/romantic. The prices are very doable with the most expensive pasta being 9gbp and pizzas starting from 6gbp. It's made fresh in front of you and it's delicious! THEY ACCEPT AMEX!!

Pdf5RTlaoKji0Usbz4_iWA.text: Worst service. Then again I'm from the states . Pizza I had was blah. I forgot what I had already. My friend loves it and is obsessed. Her pizza was pretty good. I already forgot what that was too. I wouldn't go back here

WcpJm61CMRGaBAbZaDSQpA.text: Fast, tasty, big portions, and cooked to order! If it is your first time, you have to grab a card then go to one of the counters and place your order. The cook will then swipe your card and when you leave the cashier will swipe your card to take payment.I'm not positive but it looked like the pasta is timed and will automatically pop from the boiling water once ready. Ambiance is casual and good for a quick lunch. Both of the pastas we ordered were good and we will be back for more.

R-R9ZmqJLEUGTQ_fJDa_5w.text: My favourite Italian restaurant which serves the best and freshest pizza in London .I hate Italian food except pizza and here has the best . I love the atmosphere as well .

UZzK4Lcq9L6y24qjKm3ltw.text: Well what can I say about Vapiano?I've only been here once so far on a Friday night with friends. The place is massive inside and it was packed, as is expected on a Friday night a few minutes walk from Oxford Circus. The décor is modern minimalistic but tasteful and would remind most people of the cafeterias in universities, but better food!As you walk in through the main door you have to go through these enormous red velvet curtains blocking the entrance and are given a pay card to place your order. Big mama gave me my card and I was to encounter her many times that evening.I was very hungry so ordered a barbecue chicken pizza and a carbonara. The restaurant is self service and you add your orders to your pay card and pay when you leave; an idea I think is very clever as it works like an Oyster Card. Everything is very quick to collect apart from the pizza's which you are given a flashing buzzer to let you know when to return to collect it.My food was great. I loved the carbonara, my cheesecake for desert and the many bottles of wine. I was however, very disappointed with the pizza. If I order a barbecue chicken pizza then that's what I expect, not a medium pizza with 2 little strips of chicken across the entire pizza. If that's what I wanted then I could have gone for a boring margarita. They wouldn't give me more so a barbecue pizza is what I got in the end.Now I do love the idea of the place, it's a great concept. But there were a few problems with the place, which is why I had to knock a star off the rating I was going to give it.I did feel a lot more like I was back at uni in the cafeteria rather than in a nice restaurant. It's pretty loud and the tables are all packed closely together so it's hard to have a conversation as the conversations of people sitting next to you get merged into yours.Some of my friends were late and it was noisy inside I had to keep going outside to call them. Now I know a lot of people must try and sneak out without their pay card but I gave one of the cashiers my card and my ID to prove I was coming back in after making a few quick phone calls and every time I did this, Big mama insisted on patting me down like a TSA agent. I don't know if this was necessary or if she was doing it for thrills, but by the time I left I was glad she didn't get the rubber gloves out and take me into a dark room! I'll admit, I was a bit scared....OK so overall, great quality Italian food with a quick and efficient service. If Big mama is not on the door again then I will gladly try this place again, but I won't be ordering a chickenless chicken pizza again that's for sure!

TSkC8Qeita5xs0fJFSK-qQ.text: Can't argue with a quick Italian gourmet! This place is the answer to fast fresh food, the chefs cook it in front of you made to order - never mind the lunch rush lines its quick and worth it!Unique pay option; you get a card, get your choice of food, your meal choice gets swiped onto your card, and you pay AFTER you eat.The place is great for groups with the additional seating upstairs, even when its busy- ate here for the first time a month ago with colleagues for lunch. Portions are generous, I had a tasty option of penne funghi, the pizza's are definitely big enough to share, BONUS! I wanted a bit of everything on everyones plate but i was pleasantly full

FDcQC_XIgMNc7Sti63VdAw.text: Eh. This was one of those places that could be good, but is missing some basic order. It's essentially a dining hall for office workers who are feeling nostalgic for the trays and queues of their uni days, but who have graduated to better food.Nobody at the front bothered to tell us how the system worked, and we were given two separate cards despite stating that we were just going to pay on one tab, which seemed a touch pointless. Figuring out how to order isn't rocket science, but a two-second introduction to the flow would have been nice.Veal with tuna sauce was dry, bruschetta was made with sad supermarket tomatoes that morning and they'd marinated in their own tears all day (apparently weeping for a lack of basil). Pasta was, well, pasta, with little meat, and the pizza was 'artistically' arranged with all the figs on one slice, blue cheese on another, tomatoes on another. I prefer my pizza toppings more socialistically-distributed, thanks.The ingredients, for the most part, seemed to be of good quality, and the pizza dough was solid, but this place just lacked any hint of heart and nobody seemed to take particular pride in their work, aside from the polite gentleman clearing tables.On the up side, you can skip the waterlogged desserts and get some Haribo gummy bears on the way out, paltry consolation prize though they may be.

-7zI-AoZOAskmzFAW0Ap-w.text: Well this is more of a 3.5 but I thought is skew the gradin higher rather than lower... Ok Vaps is great, it's reliable, it's cool, it's a lot if things but over time the standard of food has slightly declined. I'm a regular & have been for a few years and so I've seen it's growth in popularity but I do hope they don't drop their standards any further. This is a great place to grab affordable food in central London, that will fill you up. Its a great first date or catch up with friends location because its busy but yet you can find your own space in the place. Even takeaways are great here, if only for the bowls they give :)!

X0t1WnM2gy9CaLsrepl55w.text: Quite a simple concept here. You get a charge card, order your food at the relevant counter and swipe the card to record your order. Once you're done eating, just hand the card to the cashier and you're billed for whatever you've racked up on the card. I've seen this concept used to greater effect in the US. Vapiano only boasts a pasta, pizza and antipasti/insalate station. It would be nice if someone expanded on this concept and offered a meat section, stir-fry, seafood, crepe station, etc.I get their canteen type concept: order what you want, when you want and sit where you like. It works well for singles or couples wanting a quick lunch. But this still doesn't stop doey-eyed patrons walking around in circles for a place to eat,  tray in hand with freshly cooked food, slowly going cold. Good luck to families or groups looking for a large table. At least they can tag team while one orders and another holds the table.As for the food, the pesto and arrabbiata pastas we ordered were flavoursome and cooked al dente right in front of us. You have the option of adding extra chilli and garlic to your taste. I'll give the pizzas a try the next time I need a quick lunch.

sgwbgzzfRBmN_ZlhZ2iFIw.text: I know it's a chain and lots of people try to avoid chains in favour of small independent places now, but it does serve a purpose. If you are wandering along Oxford Street, right by Oxford Circus, and don't want to pay a lot but want a nice, casual Italian meal, this is the place for you. I first went in Berlin, then in New York, and now London and the standard of quality matched for all the locations. When you first go in, you are handed a card that you use at each station (pasta, pizza, appetisers, bar, etc) to order. Once you order, you touch your card to the reader and bring your food back to your table.  At the end of the meal (not really table service) you go up to the front and pay. This was particularly difficult for me because we got wine and I was having fun, and I couldn't keep track of how much money I was spending. Whoopsy. The casual but trendy atmosphere combined with the large communal tables with basil plants you can leaves from for your food makes it really comfortable and happy. It's not very expensive, but again, keeping track of how much money you spend isn't easy. But if you want pasta made to order that you can watch be prepared, it's pretty fun.

r-4yXUX88GPPuzjM2lkQnw.text: Close to work. Good place to come for lunch but like most places in the area if you are late the queue does build up. The food is excellent and my favourite dish is easily the Tachhino Piccante, extra spicy. I love the way I can see them cook the food and can ask them to add exact amounts of chilli, garlic etc. The staff is friendly and you can always have a laugh with them. A good place to get some time off work at lunch. I wish they'd stop asking me "Have you been to Vapiano's before?" every time I enter now - That takes a star off your score!

vV_-_2F1Gnwdolq2kuocpg.text: I've never been to a restaurant like Vapiano, so I was totally enthralled when I came here for dinner a few weeks back. Taking a charge card, ordering what you like, getting cozy in lounge chairs and eating delicious Italian is pretty amazing when you put it all together.I had a pizza, but tried a ravioli dish as well as an appetizer of raw beef and mushrooms and other things I don't normally eat but really enjoyed. As well, I loved having a fresh basil plant at the table because the whole place smelled amazing.Certainly a great concept restaurant. I could easily see it being a lot of fun for a group in need of good food and a funky atmosphere.

u4horWNPzkOcqOJRuWGTXw.text: First impression - great place to have lunch - spacious, light, fresh air, modern design (especially seeing a round table with fresh basil pots with a living olive tree growing through the middle). However, there is a huge BUT. At least weird for me and my girlfriend.. With entering we were given cards and told to have anything and that we will be charged once leaving... The staff did not want to bother with explaining details. It made us feel like we are doing a questionnaire... So soon we realised the system is based on concept of buffet. In our opinion, it was not impressive at all! We felt like cheated. Yet I had supposedly fresh orange juice, which tasted like concentrated with larger quantity of sugar cubes (not much tanginess really). We left straight after that experience - it was distressing!

fjIzr-H3OdqsbPW-6k5BoA.text: I was really surprised to find a Vapiano in London. As I am originally from Hamburg, Germany where Vapiano is from as well, I did not know it was there until I ran past it accidentally.Vapiano is a self-service restaurant just round the corner from Oxford Circus tube station. It's literally 3 minutes, just behind the Topshop flagship store.At Vapiano you find all kinds of pasta, pizza and salads. These are priced reasonable from around 5.75 a pizza/pasta.Drinks are a little more expensive compared to Germany but still a really good choice for a nice meal, inexpensive and still very central in London!

bVcNTCdXctF8jR5GWCmq3Q.text: 4 stars or 5?Well... 4 because it wasn't perfect.Why? You have to queue for your food just a LITTLE bit too long.They don't let you bring a jug of water to your table (you have to get up every time you want to refill your TINY little glass.And finally it feels a little like a cafeteria (this can be good if that's what you're after).But on the plus side...It's really good food, it's cheap, it can be quick (or you can relax and have a nice long meal), staff are friendly (for the most part), you get to watch them cook your food, it has lots of seating, it has a great location, etc... etc... etc...

ZDMHV7H2OXBqanybKmaG7Q.text: Big fan of this place. After scanning the shopping scene and picking up a new winter coat, my feet were aching and my tummy was on empty. I whipped up yelp and spotted this area for a lil carb load to get me through the night. The concept of Vapiano is quite interesting... Kinda an upscale cafeteria style of serving? You essentially get a card at the entrance, stand in line to order and pickup your food, you eat at community tables, then pay after you're done. The lines seemed to take a long time to get your food, that was about the only negative thing I could think about really... The food itself was well portioned and tasted amazing (perhaps hunger really is the best spice). Wash it down with a pint from the bar or a glass of vino and it's a solid meal!

UGmFZLIyOK88XKZyx0jx8Q.text: Awfull pasta, it was so undercooked, and do not confuse with al'dente. It is full of tourist and no tables. Cooks are rushing to serve everyone and undercook everything. Go to the Southwark branch

fbJykhOsX8MN4e17MFAfIA.text: Really, REALLY good freshly made pizza! The pasta is also freshly made to order! Very cool atmosphere as well!

mGIdDdp2snnM033q-tHIng.text: It was a crazy day on Oxford, as usual. Shopping really worked up my appetite, especially fighting the crowds at Zara during the July sales. Vapiano was the remedy to my "hangry". Lovely place that has a full assortment of wine, beer and spirits. There is also an assortment of pizza, pasta and other Italian inspired dishes. I ordered the Verdura pizza. Just the right amount of sauce and grilled vegetables. Plus the crust was thin enough to waylay my carb guilt. Will definitely be back.

MocsJ_NrQvNuFJGf9NrBNA.text: Me and a friend decided to go here because has we had heard lots of positive experiences from friends and family. Having heard the meat is halal we were eager to try out dishes we wouldn't usually be able to have in most popular restaurants. At first when we arrived we were just handed cards and not given much of an explanation about how the buffet system works. It seemed straightforward but the cards weren't explained to us. We asked a staff member and that was when we realised that everything we order will be added to the card and then we pay at the end of our time there. Once we queued up we saw there were several queues for pasta, pizza and antipasti. We decided to go for pasta and was delighted to find we could choose from a selection of freshly made pasta. You then decide the dish you want and it is prepared right in front of you! I ordered the Chicken Alfreda with tagliatelle and my friend ordered a seafood dish with tagliatelle (can't remember the name!) and both were tasty! Only downside is even though it is a buffet it seems each dish is added to the card and you are charged for separate meals, which resembles a normal restaurant system and wouldn't suit a customer on a budget! Overall a pleasant visit and will definitely consider going again if I am anywhere near Oxford street this summer!

nwWuEJb2zHtt_KHiEOb9QA.text: More style than substance; I have found Vapiano to be igniting people's interest via the novelty of picking your food and watching it being cooked before your very eyes, but in reality it is rather frustrating as you are left hungry and watching the food of all the people queuing in front of you being served. Testament to this was the fact that I saw people who were originally queuing up for pasta then decide it was taking too long and go to the pizza counter instead. Then guess what? They had their pizza cooked and served way before I even reached the beginning of the queue for pasta. I am left famished and disgruntled wondering whether this tactic of not being able to order whilst seated is actually a sinister ploy to save on employment costs as waiters were no longer needed. The bowls they serve the pasta in are somewhat heavy and awkward to manoeuvre, the trays provided do not have much grip or border making them also awkward to carry, meanwhile the cutlery and napkins are self-service by the cooking counter but even some of these supplies had run out when I was there.Anyhow, ridiculous setup aside, the pasta is admittedly of a good quality; noticeably fresh and satisfying to taste. The portion of pasta may initially look quite small but upon eating you soon realise that the density of the pasta makes it sufficiently filling. Unfortunately, nice as the food was, I wouldn't say that 'the end' justifies 'the means'; there just comes a point when you think to yourself this isn't worth the hassle. Self-service only works when it speeds up proceedings and gives you a sense of control but at Vapiano you relinquish this control and find yourself hungry, forced to stand in line, then needing to carry your food (and drink) with somewhat difficulty to seating that is actually not that comfortable before you can stop your stomach from grumbling, but your mind will continue to grumble afterwards about the torture you have just been through.

gMh_uMkHewz0TdYQSPusGw.text: Vapiano is a great restaurant offering up fresh Italian food in a rather unique manner. Unlike other restaurants, when you enter vapiano instead of asking for a table you'll instead be handed a card which is not unlike a credit card that you are told to charge all of your orders to. This system works out very well. Every time you order something, you simply swipe the card and the amount is added to your bill. Which you then pay at the end of your visit. I had a pizza and it was great. On par with any of the other major Italian restaurant chains. The service was fast and it fasted great. Overall I would recommend vapiano if you want good quality Italian food for not too high of a price.

d5tLpZtfM58xU8yE3USV7g.text: Vapiano's strength is in its unique concept (which in my mind, isn't even really that unique).  When you enter the store, you're given a card.  With it, you line up in one of pasta, pizza, and salad lines, where they cook your meal in front of you.  They add all that you ordered on to your card, and you pay on your way out.  Throughout your meal, it's all self-service e.g., you need to serve your own water, carry up your own meal if you want to dine upstairs, etc. Whilst I give it credit for the somewhat creative concept, I'm always disappointed by its food.  The pasta is never done right; I could name at least half a dozen places that does pasta better for the price.  The people that make your food in front of you are not the most responsive to your requests e.g., on both occasions when I asked if they could make my arrabiata a little spicier, all they did was throw in two more little pieces of chili peppers which defeats the purpose of having things cooked in front of you.  The water glasses are too small that you have to get up and re-fill them at least three times throughout the meal.  Finally, the line to pay on your way out is always long which once again, makes one wonder "Why this concept unless it's only for the restaurant to save cost?"I went to this place twice only because it was the chosen venue for a group meal, but I would never go here on my own.

c4auadfaGTnG0Nz7sDG80A.text: Very good fresh food, good prices too. Not a big fan of self service, but i still keep coming back)

jiLJFDT2KUYgOWf6ZLwrPQ.text: One of my favourite restaurant. It's normally busy on the weekends but worth the wait.  The pasta is out of the world and I can't get tired of having it. Definitely recommend!

HWKYig33pH0PMAYYSoyYqQ.text: I'm not sure why this place doesn't have more stars? The pasta is great, actually one of the best pastas I've had. The cook who made our order was accommodating. I got the bolognese spaghetti with extra garlic. I don't usually order spaghetti but I was recommended to get it so I did, and it was surprisingly great! The texture is different than other spaghettis I've had--it's thinner and had the perfect amount of moisture in it. Not too dry and not too soggy (most of the time, the spaghetti I order is either too soggy or too dry). Also, the extra garlic went a long way and did WONDERS for the taste of the spaghetti. Overall, really great food, really good location and really nice ambiance. I took off a star for the long queue, but I guess that's not the restaurant's fault?

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

LrtmIKw5zJn0CcUxDAWUaw.text: Whoa, this place is kind of amazing. Taking gourmet Italian and turning it into a quick cafeteria type of place is quite impressive. Thankfully I came with someone who has been here before or else I would've been one lost puppy. When you first walk in they give you a card. Then you walk up to one of the stations and order. The chefs make it right in front of you and they scan your card that you were just given. You order, eat, enjoy, and pay when you leave. Very cool, indeed. I ordered the Shrimp Scampi with Spinach pasta and it was fantastic. It was so good, I ate the whole thing! And it is an extremely generous portion for under 10 pounds. Can't wait to go back and try more things!

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Scampi E Spinaci

S5ut-BP4nxlfUI_0DqhUZQ.text: Nice quality Italian restaurant, as long as you are careful asking for them to put pepper to your taste. They tend to put too much if you mention nothing. Youth hotspot where you have to wait at the queue in different queues like for pizza and pasta, for instance, in order to get your food, only when it is ready. The good side of it is that you actually see your food being prepared, which can be really interesting. I do not love canteen style dining, but the atmosphere of this restaurant makes it up for it. This venue can get quiet packed though in busy times, so I suggest looking for different ones to avoid stress. Unless, obviously p, if you alphabet other intentions like flirting with people sitting around you. :)

0To9wB-liL2lLuRlGxFcow.text: Nothing was explained upon arrival- we were a group of 3 paying together, so when we were given our cards, we left them on our table, so when we tried to leave they demanded the cards back; we weren't told we would have to return them when we left. We had to wait 40 minutes for a margherita and because you have to queue separately (if you want to order a pasta/salad), after ordering the pizza you then have to queue for pasta, which was another 30 minutes. Good concept if you are paying separately, want to try various things on the menu and as a couple/group (and at peak time) not a great place to go, or concept. Loads of staff not doing much. Some staff very rude. For example, when leaving we were asked if we had a good visit, when we relayedthe above, she gave us dirty looks, and didn't apologise or try and change our perception.

Ht8Tm8GVRXqvXXZq3iq3Uw.text: This restaurant is a self service where you order the food at different counters and they cook is fresh in front of you, this place can be quick once you get served otherwise it's just the queuing that takes the time. The actual serving of the food is quick.. You order the base of a dish and then can choose your choice of pasta ..For seating is fight for the first place haha it's ok in the quiet times but avoid during rush peak times..The atmosphere is very loud though so not great for a first date..again this is when it is busy the rest of the times it can be quiet..They don't rush you out of the place which is a bonus once you find your perch.. Food is flavoursome and portions are filling I usually order the Chilli Chicken with my choice of pasta, it's not too spicy and I usually have to add extra chilli oil from the table.. The portion is filling..They also have a self serving salad bar and pizza selection.The drinks options are sodas behind the food counters but they have a full bar selection at a different counter.. Average price of pasta dish £6-11Depends on your budget but you'll find a meal ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

tOhwQOmkqEpeZI4pLsQWzA.text: Walk in and you get a card which gets charged everytime you order something at the counter. It's a neat idea and after we found a table we set about getting our food. One of us had to man the table while everyone else went to order their food. Due to the different lines, everyone got their food at different times, which was a bit annoying as some of us were finished with the food while others were still waiting to get theirs.  I had the red pesto pasta. I originally wanted the spelt fusilli, but they were out so I got the spelt spaghetti instead. The pasta was... ok. I though it was a bit bland and wish I has asked for chills or garlic, or something else to add flavour. They skimped on the sundried tomatoes as well. For £7 for a bowl of pasta I expected more. It's a neat concept, but it wouldn't be my top choice for dinner.

5ziS9LR574yT9ePzbjFN8A.text: Went there for the thousandth time again with a friend. I've been there on several different occasions and it is always a pleasant space if you know how it works. After you get your card and order your food, you must get a table. The space upstairs can be equally good for small meetings (Last time I was there was with a friend that was going through a rough phase) or big parties (had a blast having dinner with a group of friends and a lot of nice cocktails). The alcohol is good and the food is definitely worth the price. Absolutely nothing bad to say about it apart from the fact that the staff should consider a better room management. Big thumbs up for the costumer service of the chefs (in spite of the cashier who was tearing people a bit like cattle).

K536AIxBkEJE2hxrxrx7Nw.text: Vapiano turned out to be a bit of a lifesaverMy Yelp Elite friend Lorrie M, who was visiting London from San Jose and I had planned dinner at Savoir Faire that evening to encompass the now sadly-banned-in-California foie gras. Sadly, our original plan was rudely disrupted by some pickpockets and following a visit to the police station, we wandered in search of food, a little shell-shocked at the evening's eventsWe were on our way in search of a drink when we happened upon Vapiano and although our appetites weren't at highest levels, we decided that we needed something to eatOn entering, the hostess at the door explained the concept to us - we were given cards to charge stuff at all the cooking stations around the restaurant as well as at the bar. The menu is Italian, so there were live pasta cooking chefs, a pizza oven and a section serving starters, salads and small platesLorrie chose a pizza and I went with the caprese salad which I had spotted on another customer's table. Despite our initial lack of hunger, the food actually filled a needed spot. The pizza base was crispy and generous with toppings. The caprese salad had genrous amounts of lovely creamy mozzarela, tomatoes and fresh basil that you could replenish from a basil plant at the table! A zingy balsamic dressing brought the salad ingredients to lifeAn interesting concept and it did turn out to be just what we needed to sit down and chill out after the earlier events of the evening

1mboyX-a1ArcoGL7DPpQYA.text: When I came here, it really reminded me of Marché/Movenpick/Richtree in Toronto.I loved it.They have freshly made pizza and pasta for you with a great variety as well.  Not only that - they have a great selection of Italian desserts as well (including panna cotta, and I got myself a Baileys Haagen Dasz).I heard they might be bringing it over here to Canada!  I'm excited.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. haagen-dasz baileys ice cream for dessert
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. salsiccia con fich penne pasta

R_UBJv2jld7L8i45go8rGQ.text: Having missed out on the trend of self-service Italian restaurants so far, I experienced two in as many days. Following a relaxed late-night drink at Princi last night, I had a frustrating lunch at Vapiano today. The concept seems like a good idea at first sight, but it all fails during lunchtime rush hours. The waiting time for our food was ridiculous, and I feel £10 for a dish of pasta and a small water are a bit much - especially if you have to do most of the work yourself. OK, they cook the stuff, but that's about it.It feels like a canteen in a big German company, with the touch-in and touch-out Oyster style cards, just a lot less efficient. Not impressed.

WXcTYEL6KVyePspJpEAHNQ.text: I've been to Vapiano's countless times in quite a few countries. It's good go to pizza , pasta etc when theres little else around or if you're with kids. The selection is great and the price is right. I like the lemon and mint water that you can drink for free.If you come during lunch and dinner time rush hour you can literally wait at least 30 mins for food which is a hassle when you're starving. Regardless I would recommend eating here as the food is made right in front of you so you can adjust as needed.

UAPPQ6944oPxQwKLzEap0Q.text: I went to Vapiano three times, and I have enjoyed all visits. Food is really good. It's sort of self service (which can upset some). Price is really good, and portion size is fine.I thought it was very weird when one of the chefs said I shouldn't have the dish I chose because it was "no good". This happened in two of the visits. I think they should change the recipes if they think they aren't good.Drinks are good, but pretty small. The dessert is nice, I ordered a chocolate gelato and it didn't disappoint.Please, do have the salad with the raspberry dressing (I forgot its name!). It's the best salad I've had in my entire life.

Km4wtWxeN29v2g1vY47aWQ.text: Love this place, always busy & it's great to see your food being cooked in front of you and being able to add what you want or exclude things you might be allergic to or dislike. Pastas are all delicious and filling (my personal favourite is the scampi pasta - yum!) I do like the salads but find them quite overpriced compared to the pastas (I ordered a chicken Caesar salad this weekend which ended up being more expensive than my regular pasta!)I don't love the pizza but it's good enough and a lot of my friends really like it so all in all definitely recommend it - be prepared to wait in the queues though! Especially at peak times!!

xPBDnlVHobwxlL35V91zdA.text: I have been meaning to write about this place for AGES. I've been so many times that I have had 2 meals free - if you get 9 stamps on their loyalty card you get the 10th meal free.The idea about this place is pretty cool - you have to queue up for your food almost like a food court with a tray, but it's freshly cooked in front of you. You scan a card with your order and pay at the end. Simple!And tasty. For £8-10 you get freshly cooked pasta with decent sauces, or pizza with freshly made dough. Sometimes I think they need to inject a bit more flavour into the sauces, but then I add some herbs that are fresh on every table as a garnish and sprinkle some chilli oil over the top and it makes it all come alive. For those need a sophisticated quick bite, you can't really complain.

35k69V3dUgqS7NzsILVGhw.text: We had risotto with shrimp.  If you like heat, a lot of heat, order as is.  If you aren't crazy with the heat, ask them to take it down a few notches.  The wait around 9:30 PM on a Thursday was over 30 minutes for pasta and risotto. They make it fresh and custom-made for you while you stand there and wait for it. The salad and pizza lines were almost nonexistent.There are comfy bench couches and a little stools that are less comfortable towards the back. It seems like a good place for a lot of conversation because this place is extremely loud. Even after people are done eating they sit and chat for quite a while.

ytdkER34lSQGLn8RsoFMmw.text: I'm a huge Vapiano fan.  I had my first experience 2 years ago with a location in Paris and I've been dreaming of the Carbonara since then.  When I saw there were locations in London I was ecstatic.  So on our first night in London we ventured to Vapiano.We arrived around 9pm.  It was packed.  We got in line to order our food.  The wait was no more than 15 minutes.  They were limited on the pasta selections since it was late so I opted for the Carbonara with paparedelle, my sister Carboanara with Prawns with tagliatelle. The cook made my pasta perfectly and asked if I wanted garlic and chilis and confirmed the quantity.  It was perfect! A few days later we decided to come back for another visit to make sure we got our Vapiano fill before we departed.  This time we were there around 10pm.  The line wasn't as long but took much longer to get waited on.  When I told the cook what we wanted he just asked what kind of pasta, there were only 3 types left so we chose campanelle.  We did not get asked about garlic and chili so we asked the cook and he said he'd already put it in.  We also asked about the parsley on top and he said they were out.  He had cooked it much faster then it's taken previous times.  We had ordered it To-Go since it was late.  We looked at our food and saw no chilis.  We brought this to the manager's attention when we were paying and he just said "Oh" and didn't care, just asked for payment.  When we got back to our hotel to eat, the sauce was watery and not flavorful.  There was also no garlic taste or chilis.  It was very disappointing and ruined the Vapiano experience for me.  No such thing as great customer service here.  They didn't care that their cook provided awful service and sub-par food.  Had it not been for the last trip there this would have definitely been a 4 or 5 star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Carbonara is amazing!

BQtNguPYkR1ja_6XP1KvHQ.text: I love the Vapiano brand.  The restaurants are really great and I love how you line up and order your entrée and they make it right in front of you.  The first time I went in Paris, I was in love and have been thinking about it since so when we saw there were some locations in London, we added it to the list.  Yes, it's a chain but unlike any chain we have in the US that offers a quality product in a pretty cool atmosphere.This would have been a five star review if we had only come once.  On our first stop, we had impeccable service.  I ordered the Carbonara with Tagliatelle pasta with Prawns and bread.  The cook that took the order was awesome, he asked my preference for chilis, parsley and cheese.  The bread was fresh and tasty.  We got a bottle of water and had an absolutely wonderful meal.  We checked out easily and had a very nice dinner.A couple days later we wanted it again, we got there pretty close to closing time though so we ordered to go.  I got the carbonara again but they were out of the long pastas so I got the gemelli.  I also didn't get prawns but ordered bread.The cook this time seemed like he was done for the night even though they had a half hour left and still had lines.  He wasn't very nice.  Threw the pasta together way too quickly where the sauce was very watery and put in no chilis, wouldn't ask us, when we asked about the parsley he said they didn't have any and was just rude, if you don't have the items to make the pasta right, tell the customer, I would have ordered something else.He put a little cheese on top but it was just not good, very bland.  Before we left, we tried talking to the manager because we could see it hadn't been made correctly.  They just blew us off and asked for the payment.  So rude, the service was just terrible.  I was very disappointed and because of this experience, I wouldn't return.  If it had been another 5 star like the first time, we probably would have been back a couple more times, but they just ruined it and treated us like a bother when they messed up the dish.

2cG2lkuBxc-KDZ_9WM_NBA.text: We decided to try this place after walking pass it a few times during our visit. This is an interesting concept - make your own pasta and pizza. The ambience is quite inviting with large tables that encourage gathering and connecting. However, the food is rather disappointing - everything tastes the same is the bottom line. So we decided to give this place a 3 - 4 for the inventive concept and ambience and 2 for food, which has room for improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

nTjJVfsTGnZe5KHhRzqBdg.text: I always come here for a quick bite with my husband and kids , it's always busy pizza is great and the pasta is also very tasty .

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

S2QPv6vKiD7g6be4W4MXlA.text: Good fresh food, made in front of you. This location was fairly quick and had enough seating. Really tasty plus so many choices of different pastas.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. So tasty

O1E74AnYpXpbo58XkszVxw.text: This place is very meh. I've been to the one in Union Sq, NYC and that one is delicious.  - my friends pasta was undercooked. They tried to protest and say it's how the pasta comes but I even tasted it and it felt almost raw. - they _we're_ great about making another- my pizza was very meh. I think it's pretty common to have pizza above meh, so this was pretty disappointing

9ha4yV5AlDLYWbxWxpVKyQ.text: The food here is sooooo fresh, so yeah they're busy during peak hours but totally worth the wait. They cook all the food in front of you (which you can customize) and it's a pretty cool system of charging you on individual cards. Love it here!

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

8epT3YPsDTCE6xNUxh968Q.text: Vapiano is my another favourite restaurant for quick meal. Lunches always busy there . Self service. Love their pizza .  Food comes quickly as well. Lovely carbonara pasta . will come back again .

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. nothing much to say .enjoy girls :)

ND_xEPK4QrE9oQJcjMTgVg.text: First restaurant I've visited since visiting old London Town & I was not disappointed! I came here to meet a friend for lunch & enjoyed every part of my meal. I am unsure what my dish was called (because my friend chose it for me) but it was a nice pasta dish with peppers, basil, prawns with a yummy creamy sauce! The layout, decor & seating are very nice & each compliment each other.This place is extremely busy at lunch time (12.30 PM onwards)...so avoid if you can!
