TfP3vpQkojWDcsy9teXezQ.text: Food is amazing but, they seriously need to care about the customers experience. I don't think the queuing system is working especially when it's meal time. It's unfair to queue up for an hour if you get a slow cook, than for those who arrived 30 mins later than you, but get  served before you. This queuing system benefits the restaurant as they don't need to hire too many waitresses, but I, as a customer, have to queue for at least 60+ mins for food. Please, just hire waitress to serve food.

aM1gc-_0PhdrfDuhXUV6lQ.text: My younger sister took me to vapiano, and judging from the packed restaurant I knew I was in for a treat.All their pastas are made within the restaurant which is passed to the chef and your meal cooked right before your very own eyes. The food is fresh and tasty and the restaurant itself is buzzing with a good vibe . It's not pricey and the portion size is amazing....can't wait to go back there !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Pasta at its best !!!
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Creamy mouth watering pasta
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Fresh doughy pizza and spaghetti carbonara

MUaVIjnl1u13anKUdhKr6w.text: 4 stars for a canteen (as it is more of one than a restaurant). You need to queue up to different stalls to order/pick up food.The food was good and it seems like a fun and lively atmosphere but was quite loud and hard to hear people speak. Definitely great place to get lunch while at work and I think that's their main client.

LcBdWbJub8mYfXbGfyRY5A.text: Really good pizza, really bad service. The woman serving dessert was so rude that I left with a bad taste in my mouth (no pun intended)! It's also difficult for a first-timer who doesn't know how their system works. Staff members shouldn't assume and get irritated when customers don't get it straight away.

-h82kypVaR2JP_8JETUg_A.text: Decent fresh food made right in front of you - nothing special besides the "experience", good prices, come early to avoid queues :)

YTpQanhcpqx8GM2eMqEmtw.text: Great for a group, choose your food downstairs (from an Italian menu);... and then everyone pays on their own tab (given as you walk in the door). Stops all those arguments about who had what when it comes time to pay the bill (hate that bit of a group dinner) Affordable and fun, what's not to love :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. There's three types of herbs to choose from, pluck and add to your food.
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Downstairs is always packed, but you can usually find space upstairs. Pick your fav herbs directly from the plants.

RRqs3fnQlunrtZscD7EQCA.text: Probably one of the worst restaurant systems there is. You have to wait in a long line, depending on the day, probably 20 mins. The cooks have to prepare the pasta in the moment: so you can't order and sit down. So 30 minutes standing to get your food. And if you want to get pasta and a salad per say, you have double the amount of time. Great food. Inefficent system. Very annoying.

_cvZwrIBxi9ElueWQpfYzQ.text: I went there with friends after a very exhausting 10K run to re-carb.The place runs in a unique way. Think about it as dine in but being on a street food market. Basically, you are given a card that will be charged with anything you order (you pay at the exit to the cashier). You try to find a table, then you wander around and pick what you want.The really great thing is you can see your food being prepared. I am a real sucker for this so I was in heaven. The cook is talking to you asking if you want specific spices in like garlic chillies and how much you want. That was excellent. Feel like on street market. Eat like in a good restaurant. Fantastic!Right, there are two main sections: pastas and pizzas. There are multiple parallel queues for those and having good strategy means saving possibly half an hour of your time. Pizzas take longer to make so order them first. You will get a buzzer to pick them up when they are ready. In the meantime head over to pasta section and get them to your table.As you may already noticed the service is nonexistent, you have to do everything yourself. There are people picking up the empty plates for you. But you don't pay service charge or tip.The food quality is ok. I wouldn't say it's the best that I've eaten but the portions are really satisfying. In particular, pasta was prepared very very quickly. The cook was preparing it in some kind of a wok mixing and stirring ingredients vigorously. It was Italian stir fry essentially. One of my friends loved it. I had a bit of reservations to this food preparation technique. We had pizza calzone as well. The dough was quite nice. The spicy sausages were also stellar. Overall pretty good spot!I definitely recommend it to runners!

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. This is the masterpiece of pasta artery. Nothing else to explain!!!!

nzZKpqwgfNMV8tkOhpuJ4A.text: Who thought this was a good idea?Take below-average Italian food. Remove the service element and replace with a Service Station, queue up-order-wait-pickup style arrangement. All at the same price (or more than) you'd pay in a decent small family Italian restaurant. In the pursuit of efficiency charm, friendliness and atmosphere have been culled. And after you've stood queuing for 15 minutes for a basic bowl of pasta you'd probably question the efficiency too. My idea of hell. Never again.

CKnvDUxgLRuofaMTT2Y44A.text: Loving this restaurant with a difference and can easily see the appeal for the customer.  The ambiance of the place is fresh, clean and vibrant.  I was eating on my own so wasn't overalled at having to seat myself after collecting my first course! Not a good call for the solo diner!This cruise ship style dining is perfect for those wanting a little more free reign almost, and seeing it cooked or prepared in front of you.You get given a credit style card upon entry and swipe your card at each order point to rack up your tab.I ordered bruschetta and whilst it was being prepared I placed an order for a calzone pizza and was given a pager for when that would be ready.   I also took a drink from the antipasti station where they promptly swiped my card!After I had eaten the starter my pager went off and off I popped (leaving my jacket on my stool with a group of 4 girls on my same bench table).  I returned to find my jacket still there and my messy side of the table untouched too!  My calzone was not the best ever choice, as I felt it had not been in the oven long enough and the cheese was barely melted and the pizza base only lightly cooked. (On reflection I should have complained).Desert time quickly arrived and I choose the small tiramisu and blueberry cheesecake.  (£2.50 each) Both tasted as though they had been prepared fresh but much earlier in the day.  Although quality ingredients they both lacked that 'Mmmmmm' taste factor, quite bland in fact to which I was NOT expecting considering their initial appeal to me!I will return but next time ignore the pasta waiting lines and just join up and will come with friends not on my 'Billy'...

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. I could not decide on Blueberry Cheesecake or Tiramisu... So both it is!! :-0
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

hEQIXfWeFI1VBiaxCX4o0g.text: Lovely food, great concept, fresh food cooked in front of you with fresh ingredients, I don't see what more you could ask for. Price is reasonable, the atmosphere is great. Definitely recommended. (Well at least the pasta is)

88jzl_GWkyYBcj41G_h9cA.text: i love this place - its bustling but never too rammed - i really rate their pizza's although i think PArmesan should be just there for anyone - apparently you need to pay extra! rather annoying! i love the basil plants on all the tables - i killed mine yesterday at lunch! yum! great idea, great meeting place, good food for the price too.

7jDn2mEqBlO8HoOJZOXumQ.text: Pretty cool place - food is all really fresh and tasty. They operate on a very modern system where you get a "credit" card when you go in and put everything you have on the card then pay at the end as you walk out. Pasta is cooked right in front of you while pizzas are done in a pizza oven and you are given a buzzer which goes off when it's ready. Only problem with this place is that if it's busy the wait can be bad otherwise it's great place to relax with great food.

4a9AzSz-C96EmRXPLuZH4g.text: Best place for pizza in the area hands down. Have been here several times now, and have enjoyed every meal very much. Well worth checking out.

HLpQeRcnSMt1DqlJwMhExA.text: Great for pizza and pasta and just round the corner from the Qype office.

Esm0OWyFGpipIMFVH5YrZg.text: Like the concept. You're given an electronic card when you come in, on which you can record all your takings and just pay on your way out. The food is fresh, the staff always greeting you with a smile (most of them Italian) and you get a choice of salads, pizzas or pasta. There's a large seating area but you can also take away if you prefer. The only drawback for me (but supposedly great for them) is that the place is always packed. Therefore you never really get the chance to eat together. Whether I came in with a friend or with a group, I never actually had a chance to eat all at the same time. You can wait for ages if you don't come right before or after lunch timewhich kind of defeats the purpose of having lunch, right? Besides, don't go there if on a low budget and just want a lunch break, £8.10 for a pizza or pasta, a bit dear. Yes, definitely fresh, cooked in front of you and worth trying without a doubt but it's not somewhere you'll go every day for lunch, unless you won the lottery

A9BFDhXu8Y8KlvE-J0rO6w.text: The pizza is suprisingly good, but I actually find that the pasta is usually undercooked and the cooking is inconsistent depending on your server. I like the upstairs lounge tables, and overall the place is solid, although a bit expensive for what you get.

MRNcjH-zuVpH7XSe_rJQJg.text: Nice place, went to the chain a few times in HH and it's a good import from across the North Sea. Fast, good value, fresh food. Recommend to stick to salad and pasta: the pizzas are just about average. Great italian food for lunch.

H_iMyMTG0qlFoPp2-RuFMw.text: quite possibly the best pasta/pizza restaurant that i have ever visited with such quick service. Food is always great and very relaxed atmosphere

we_XLUB_ni81bjDg3FFwjw.text: You need a bit of imagination if you are shopping in Oxford street and don't feel like eating junk food. Well Vapiano offers Italian, fresh food, and fast.I discovered only later that this is a chain as well, but the first branch in London. I would not go there for a candle light dinner but for lunch the place is great. The idea is that you do it all by your self ( except cooking the food). You get this chip card and you choose what you want to eat and in every food station has machine you that records the price. Oh well, it really is not that complicated and once you have done it the first time, you will know the game.The best part is that the chefs prepare the food in front of you. You get to say exactly how much chili you want etc. It is wicked! And the food, pasta, pizza, salads, antipasto, is great with great prices (mains up to £8.50) if you keep on mind the Oxford Circus location.We visited the place with my work colleagues and it was great when we did not have to go through all that splitting the bill operation.

LTfqBrRANGCpS9QKGwhk3g.text: My first time at Vapiano last week thanks to a recommendation of my German flatmate. I have to admit, I like the concept even if it is a German chain serving up Italian food. Upon entry, they hand you are card to charge all your food and drink to. Upon exit, you pay for the damage. It was really quite busy when we dropped by, considering it was a Thursday evening (not the type of place I imagine people hanging out but clearly I was wrong). The food is made (sort of) fresh in front of you and the service was quite friendly. Overall a good experience, and probably a pretty darn good option for lunch. If you can fit it in, the dessert is worth a splurge.

-3GW6I5tjmKAAb5w3ZXMsg.text: YAY! So glad there a Vapiano in London! The food is so so good. For those who don't know Vapiano: You come in and get a swipe card. Then you go to one of the counters where they freshly cook for you. Pizza, Pasta, Antipasti, Salad. Everything is really fresh, really delicious and not even expensive. When you leave you hand over your card and pay at the end. I don't mind the self-service at all. However it is good to sit upstairs if you want it to be a bit quiet! I recommend Parpadelle Funghi and Bruscetta. And whatever you have ordererd - you can get free slices of bread at teh salad counter!!!

4wln768wEJU47HwCyCfIlA.text: I was lucky enough, not long ago to come across the great promotion that kicked off this lovely restaurant: food for free. Can you believe it? Doesn't matter, I will tell you anyway.The restaurant is, to start with, different. As opposed to Carluccios or Strada, in these floor there is room to spare. as soon as I came in The first thing that caught my eye was that in every single table you have got a nice little rosemary and basil plant.cooks dish out your stuff in front of you, organized in various queues for pasta, for pizza and for saladsAs you may figure out I ate until I dropped. So did my friends. I ordered a orange-twisted pasta, and it did the job for me. Perhaps i have been slighlty put-off by the measuring obsession and the gloves the chefs used that reminds me a fast-food chain, all contributing to an artificial feeling. nevermind. I'm sure if they did not use gloves some fussy dry-capuccinos lady would complain as if in standards kitchens cook worn plastic gloves.Pizza wasn't that kick-asses. Rather bland, but i appreciated the thinness of the base. I also got to try my friend's stuff, and I have to say the Caesar salad was off the hook. desserts were nice but not great. they were served in little airtight containers that clicked on me.prices are reasonable, although as I said i did not pay for the food.upside: space, decor, see your food being cooked, daring recipesdownside: slow unexperienced cooks,

3rHJgih0MFE_I9vnPBpCJg.text: I've been going to Vapiano ever since i started working in central London. Queuing up is a little frustrating but the food is amazing, fresh and tastes really good.

BVHERSyqX6ecA1hvksPZ0A.text: fresh pastas, pizze, antipastos and some nice desserts. good to have fresh ingredients italian food in hurry(with some raw GREEN basil on ur table!). - even take a way(not recommend)

mGLiQrSBMLBZlmksmFaU6A.text: Qype must be a joke, with 9 positive reviews about this restaurant! This place is a living oxymoron. Only a German chain could think of applying fast food to Italian dishes. The quality of pasta is not really good, food is made quickly and the pasta is slightly overcooked. And it does not come cheap. I also do not understand the enthusiasm for the swipe card; we are at a restaurant, not in a Tube station.It may be okay if you are on a rush, otherwise avoid it. Especially if you love Italian food.'nuf said.

KIa5M_tToFCB-EjMiq30Sw.text: i went here a few months ago and i got the spag bol with buschetta on the side, and it was absolutely gorgeous, one thing i also love about this place is the reusable take away containers!!!

WIugdLsCLknGsiA4Bqpfwg.text: Portions are very small if ordering ravioli so avoid. Food is not amazing but is freash. If you dont like standing and waiting for your food dont come here. Your average que takes about 20 mins so be warned.

9L_-JS8yWABPFkDEkP9CDA.text: I adore Vapiano's bruschetta. They make it properly (no dried-out tomato-paste). The pasta is delicious - the best I've ever had (maybe it's the freshness?). Paying for food separately using their swipe-card system makes things easy for larger groups. There's a great sense of space in the restaurant (without a creepy "no-one comes here" feeling) and I've never felt rushed.

GmTzJBBwE3IpY3Es9lunLA.text: A really good place to eat whether it be a fast lunch or sit down dinner or drinks. Nice atmosphere and great food- freshly cooked infront of you!

C0GeAGdYKYy5JSG4MV0JBg.text: I'm with Stephen Taylor on this joint; service styled very much on an American university canteen, with a similarly annoyingly wait while the person you need to pour the nearly-hot soup makes up a salad for the guy in front while the guys at the neighbouring pizza counter do nothing. And say "ask there (pointing two feet away) for soup. Sbarro, I think it was, kicked this idea off, though their food was pretty dreadful. I thought, mournfully, of New Covent Garden minestrone as I ate my Vapiano version, and headed elsewhere for my secondo.

ZSYcz5FturX-pzgTOHHDaA.text: Vapiano serves freshly prepared pastas and pizzas.  You get a number of choices and create your own dish which is cooked in front of you.  Its quick and delicious.  It can take a while if there are long line ups but the freshly made pasta in house can make it worthwhile.  Though satisfying, I'd have to agree with others who've said the food is nothing to write home about.

2Z0RpTn-DOMAVrZuoVTi1Q.text: Vapiano has a very trusting outlook on bill paying as they operate on the basis of everyone swiping a card every time they buy something before and only paying at the end. Now, obviously I'd never dream of walking out ;-) without paying but it does strike me as likel;y that other people would. Away from that though it is a nice restaurant/bar with good looking food (yet to try it) and well kept beer, what's more they've got a couple of benches outside to watch the world go by (and inhale it too).

mlZhpxSK5xUWln2ggpkMvA.text: I love this place! Specifically, I love the way the bartender from the upstairs section made my mojito. The pizza is fantastic, the pasta wonderfully cooked and they never rush you. There are a variety of places to sit from long high tables like tall picnic tables to normal tables to a lovely sunken living room with comfy chairs. Everything is lovely here and very posh and modern. I really enjoy visiting here!

H0PIUxsG2dNAQNL5jUxTcA.text: I think maybe it's an age thing. But I am struggling with why everyone raves about the self-service school canteen type arrangement here. It's not that intuitive and I'm not convinced of the efficiency (which I assume is why they do it). Having said that it does allow for cooked-on-the-spot pasta and pizza, and my first experience of the latter was positive; a properly crispy and tangy 4 cheese affair. That and a decent mixed side salad (obtained from a different queue)made it a good lunchtime spot. Good value for money as well (maybe the efficiency thing does work for them).

X4Ys7iYTvPdF7Beu1XRy8g.text: Really tasty food. Not to hot on the dessert thought. Also the food can take a while to come but I don't mind its worth the wait. Or maybe it just feels like its a long time as when you want pasta as you have to wait standing! Anyway I love thier concept of using a swipe card and the staff are always friendly.

InLMwIx4uzufOqWirI7g7Q.text: Vapiano is by far my most beloved italian restaurant in London! I've been to a few of the Vapiano restaurants - for example the ones in Dortmund and Essen. Let's start with their food. The salads are just nice. I love that you have the full choice of what you want in your salad, which dressing, which bread etc. The pasta is nice as well! I love the wholegrain pasta the most! If you haven't tried it yet - give it a shot! The selection of pasta is very nice as well.. There are some spicy, some vegetarian and of course the classics like bolognese or carbonara. The pizza is delicios as well. I don't like the fat american pizza. So I love the thin crispy pizza's of Vapianos. Their wine is nice as well.. There is one white wine called ...Cattarano (sorry dont remember the whole name). It's not only cheap but delicious as well! Remember you can buy full bottles for take-away as well! The service and waiting times are very good and therefore there is almost nothing I could complain about Only thing is that compared to Vapiano's in Germany their indoor's don't look as nice. It's still nicely decorated, but the one's in Germany are just even more beautiful :P I also miss a larger outdoor area!

8X3Anqq8vBJyaYgHkpLLDA.text: Vapiano was a hideous dining experience, reminded me of all inclusive buffet on holiday or worse the school canteen! The concept is to pick and collect your own food and drink but in a more trendy setting than eating in the restaurant within Debenhams and then pay at the end with a swipe card.You go in, find a nice table and then have to get up and queue for your food, holding onto your coat and bag (coz this is central London), if as in my case you decide to eat Pizza and your friend goes for Pasta you join 2 seperate queues, wait a ridiculous amount of time considering this is supposed to be a convenient/efficient restaurant and then queue again for a drink. You may then find that one of you has your food and drink ready to return to the table and eat while the other is given a pager to wait for their food to be brought over by a waitress. So one of you eats their meal (as you have no way of knowing how long the food will be and no staff to moan to about the delay) and then has to wait for the other to be served and eat theirs.The whole point of this place is it is self service and by paying at the end so you are not delaying starting eating. Perhaps the business plan was that people would buy lots of food and drink without realising how much the cost was, hat would be true if you didn't have to leave your table, posessions and friends to order each time.I would only eat in a Vapiano again if I was alone in a foreign country and on a real budget. The people that have reviewed this place thus far seem to have done so based purely on price, if you think this is worthy of 4 stars try Nandos you'll be blown away!

SwekiDfTS3u0WQkO0iR3NQ.text: What a cracking little place!! Well not so little actually as it has 2 floors! If you are looking for somewhere at lunchtime to have some fresh pasta (or indeed pizza or even salad) in a nice venue where the bill doesn't make you break out in a cold sweat, then give this place a try! The service is very good, as it was my first time a lovely gentleman even helped me through the process! (The Manager!!) To add to the experience there was no waiting for the bill, a quick trip to the cash point with your wee credit card thing and 'zap' you have paid with no hassle! I can see this place being a new lunchtime hang out for me!

SAxBWQ8NfnFLkLjtCv5tWA.text: From the street this place looked quiet appealing with the glass wall, very considerable amount of space for a London restaurant and the stylish modern interior design, so we decided to try it for lunch. It serves a standard variety of pizza, pasta and salad dishes. Speaking of the quality, the pizza was made of fresh ingredients and baked in the proper oven, but generally tasted fairly plain. There wasn't anything particularly special about most other dishes we had either. The unique ordering system where you have to order at the counter, then you are called back to pick it up and then pay at the exit, may help to save five minutes if you're in a hurry, but personally I prefer restaurants with normal service arrangements so that I have an option to leave a tip. The impression from this restaurant I was left with was overall pretty average. This place is ok for lunch if you happen to be in that area, but I wouldn't come here often otherwise.

3gWO1gDd-5Q8jThkQZRvUA.text: I ate here the other day with a friend. We had some pasta. It was pretty good, you pick your own ingredients and then they make it for you. To my pleasant surprise it was excellent. The price was very good. The service was outstanding !! It was very clean there as well. The bathrooms in particular were spotless. Wow really impressed me. I will eat there again soon. I highly recommend it, if you are close to oxford street. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

vMIDu2__lLb_krmmEySNmw.text: I'm a real fan of this place. The novel charging mechanism makes it really easy to bring a mate - since everything they order goes on their card, not yours. The beef carpaccio is to die for - absolutely excellent stuff - and while others here say that the pizza is a bit bland, I find it just fine - very tasty. Those of us who sometimes don't have space for a starter (have you -seen- me? No, have you seen me, really?) won't get that embarrassing pause while everyone else is eating, since you order when you want to. I really do like the plan behind this restaurant, even if it occupies the former home of a microbrewery (and only sells fizzy lager). Recommended.

Zuy0VHxpo3qA6rGwrjdt7g.text: yeh this is a novel dinning experience. im not even gonna try and explain how the 'order on your card then pay after' thing works im way too tired and i completely FAILED at that.But im gonna stick my neck out and say that I had the best tasting pizza ive ever had in this place. i got the bruschetta pizza - like a big massive bruschetta bread!

ceixJxsH1Rt25CBNTj7Vdw.text: Great place for fresh, fast Italian pasta, pizza or salad. The concept means you collect a card at the door and swipe when you place an order. Saves you waiting for the bill if you're in a rush at lunchtime.Two downsides to this place are, it can be noisy, so I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic meal or special occasion.Second, if you want to add or remove ingredients on the menu (ie: add salami on a pizza that doesn't have it, whereas they have it on another) so I would be wary if you have any special dietary requirements (or fussy eater!) Other than that it's good value for money. Oh and there's free sweets on the way out!

jNpaCT-DeHhSjizcbqR5RQ.text: Slightly different italian restaurant concept. You go to a variety of bars to order the food and drinks, swiping a card for each dish you order which is swiped at the till to add it up on your way out. No more waiting for bills!Food priced ok, and was all very tasty the couple of times have been. It's really about basic italian food, (pizza, pasta or salad) in a more upmarket fast food environment. All food is cooked in front of you and the portions are fine, some of the pasta ones look slightly small but have found them filling enough.Fresh herbs grown on the premises a nice touch.

sM4jnUcquH_h9UnE2_O63w.text: I love the food here, its all cooked in front of you and the restaurant itself is has great lighting. it has a good atmosphere and is quite cheap for what it is. definitely recommend.

i4y19FGyJu7iaAnEfjhllw.text: great prices, hassle-free, delicious pasta, good ambience. (cute guy cooking your pasta across the counter is also a plus). wanna come back as often as possible

Ry8WS7H6tAF7SOwW30ZKZQ.text: Quite good place to stop by. Once there becareful, a nice lady we'll hand in to you a card to add up all what you'll consume thereafter, which mean that you don't really feel you're buying things. The food is quite nice too, taste, something too greasy but sincerely well cooked.

3wvKvhKndW6jk1-_9i-50g.text: Vapiano is a very casual restaurant, not at all a special occasion destination. However, if you want a casual place, especially for a larger group, this is a great restaurant to try. The card system makes the bill paying super easy...everyone pays for themselves.The set up of ordering at a counter is what, to me, makes this location informal, and honestly I was not expecting much. I ordered a pizza which took about ten minutes and it was actually very delicious. I had pesto pizza with tomatoes. The wine list was pretty good as well.
